com.vlad.rain.ai

Class Droid

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vlad.rain.ai.Droid

  • public class Droid
extends java.lang.Object
    Will handle the move commands for both AI and human player

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Droid(com.vlad.rain.level.Level level, java.util.ArrayList<com.vlad.rain.entity.mob.Player> players, com.vlad.rain.ai.data.Difficulty difficulty)
      The main constructor of a Droid oject, it takes a reference to the level (i.e the map), a list with all the Players, and the Difficulty the Player should live up to.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Mutates the game Tree following the move of a Player.

      Retuns the int key event code representing the desired move.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Droid

        public Droid(com.vlad.rain.level.Level level,
             java.util.ArrayList<com.vlad.rain.entity.mob.Player> players,
             com.vlad.rain.ai.data.Difficulty difficulty)
        The main constructor of a Droid oject, it takes a reference to the level (i.e the map), a list with all the Players, and the Difficulty the Player should live up to.

        Depending on the provided Difficulty level, the Player will either be making erratic, random decisions(EASY); better ones calculated by moving 3 level deep in the gameTree, or play HARD by looking 6 level deep in the game Tree.

    • Method Detail

      • bestMove

        public int bestMove()
        Retuns the int key event code representing the desired move. This is later fed directly into the Key object of said player in order to make the Droids move as per their behaviour.

        Returns:
        the int key code of the best move the player may take.
        See Also:
        int}

      • actualMove

        public void actualMove(int move)
        Mutates the game Tree following the move of a Player.

        Following a given keycode representing the key of the last move of a player; translates the key to a Moves and and updates the game Tree accordingly.

        Parameters:
        move - the int move.
